section.title: Connecting to a Cluster
section.para: When starting qluman-qt, it asks for the password to your certificate safe. The certificate safe contains the login informations for your clusters and private keys for each account. The password for the certificate safe is required on every start and whenever changes to the safe need to be safed. You can have the client remember the password for the duration it is running by checking the Remember password checkbox. If you are starting qluman-qt for the first time and therefore have no certificate safe yet this dialog is skipped and an empty Connect Cluster dialog opens directly. See below about how to add a new cluster.

Having entered the correct password for the certificate safe the Connect Cluster dialog opens. The last cluster used will be pre-selected but a different cluster can be selected from the drop-down menu. Click the Connect button to connect to the selected cluster.
If this is the first time you connect to the cluster, the client generates a random public and private key pair, that will eventually be used for permanent authentification of the chosen user with this cluster. It then connects to the server and tries to authenticate itself using the one-time token. On success, the server stores the public key of the client for future logins and the client stores both the private and public keys in the certificate safe finalizing the initial handshake.
The GUI client asks for the password for the certificate safe to store the generated public/private key pair. It will only do this when you initially connect with a one-time token. For future connections, the stored key pair will be used to connect and authenticate. The safe contents will then not be changed again.

section.title: Managing Clusters
section.para: The Manage Clusters dialog manages all your acounts on different clusters or as different users. It allows adding new cluster acounts, editing existing acounts or removing obsolete acounts as well as changing the password for the certificate safe. It can be opened by clicking Edit in the Connect Cluster dialog.

section.title: Adding a new Cluster
section.para: To add a new cluster click the New button and select New Cluster (paste) or New Cluster (file) from the menu depending on whether you want to paste the one-time token or load it from a file. If you don't have a ont-time token for the cluster see .

Paste the one-time token data into the dialog and click Decrypt or select the file for the token. When asked for the password enter the pin you used when creating the token. The dialog should then show the server infos that where included with the one-time token. If you started qluman-qt on your workstation then you might have to change the Local Hostname to use the external name of the head-node. Similarly if you changed the port for qlumand you have to adjust that too. The Alias is the name the cluster will use in the drop-down menu in the Connect Cluster dialog. Click Ok to add the cluster connection.

After adding the new cluster select Save to save the changes. If this is your first cluster then it will create the certificate safe and ask you to enter and confirm a password. Otherwise it will ask for the existing password unless the Remember password checkbox was enabled.

section.title: Sorting multiple clusters
section.para: When dealing with multiple clusters the clusters can be reordered using drag&drop to move them to the desired location in the list. Clusters can also be grouped together by first creating a new group and then dragging the cluster into the group. The tree structure in the Manage Clusters dialog will be reflected in the drop-down menu in the Connect Cluster dialog. This allows even large installations with multiple cluster to remain managable for the admin. Normal users will most likely not need this feature.

section.title: Changing the certificate safe password
section.para: The Manage Clusters dialog allows changing the password for the certificate safe. This requires entering the old password for the safe as well as the new password and a confirmation of the new password. The Ok button will only be selectable if the new password and confirmation matches.
